meanings.definition: A person who believes in and promotes the truth or benefits of an idea or theory.
meanings.sent1: As an exponent of renewable energy, she tirelessly advocates for solar power.
meanings.sent2: The scientist was a well-known exponent of the theory of evolution.
meanings.sent3: The exponent of healthy eating practices always brought kale chips to the office.
meanings.sent4: She was the exponent of positivity, spreading joy wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The exponent of kindness touched many lives with her compassionate actions.

meanings.definition: A number that indicates the power to which another number is raised.
meanings.sent1: In the equation, the exponent of 2 is crucial for solving the problem.
meanings.sent2: The exponent in math class today was about understanding powers and roots.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student changed the exponent in the formula to confuse his classmates.
meanings.sent4: The exponent of 10 in the scientific notation made calculations easier.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the exponent of a number helps in simplifying complex calculations.

meanings.definition: A symbol placed above and to the right of a number to show the power to which the number is raised.
meanings.sent1: The exponent in the math problem was a small number above the base.
meanings.sent2: When dealing with exponents, it's important to remember the order of operations.
meanings.sent3: The exponent on the whiteboard was written in colorful chalk to grab attention.
meanings.sent4: The exponent of 3 squared was clearly shown in the algebraic expression.
meanings.sent5: The exponent of 5^2 was neatly written next to the base number.
